Kāinga Ora spent $20m buying Auckland land for social housing - it sits vacant six years later, housing plans scrapped https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kainga-ora-spent-20m-buying-auckland-land-for-social-housing-it-sits-vacant-six-years-later-housing-plans-报废/CYWP34PDRFADFD6EHC6TQ775HI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kainga-ora-spent-20m-buying-auckland-land-for-social-housing-it-sits-vacant-six-years-later-housing-plans-报废/CYWP34PDRFADFD6EHC6TQ775HI/ Lane NicholsThe sale was the subject of a protected disclosure that resulted in a confidential payout. Sat, 27 Jul 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Kāinga Ora purchased this 1.5ha plot of land at 80 Don McKinnon Dr in Albany for nearly $20m in 2018. Six years on it remains vacant with construction yet to begin. Photo / Supplied
Patching over: King Cobras defect to Comancheros as gang expands into rival’s turf in Auckland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/patching-over-king-cobras-defect-to-comancheros-as-gang-expands-into-rivals-turf-in-auckland/IED4OKIJCFFNPDNAXPDYFTTDKU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/patching-over-king-cobras-defect-to-comancheros-as-gang-expands-into-rivals-turf-in-auckland/IED4OKIJCFFNPDNAXPDYFTTDKU/ Jared Savage, George BlockComanchero takeover could inflame tensions in volatile gang sceneSat, 27 Jul 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The new central Auckland chapter of the notorious international outlaw gang the Comanchero Motorcycle Club (CMC) announced their arrival with this post on a private social media page, shared widely in the underworld. The ACCA acronym features in many Comanchero tattoos, clothing items and social media posts - the pledge stands for "Always Comancheros, Comancheros Always". The 1% denotes outlaw motorcycle clubs, who embrace the term "one percenters" alluding to a comment by a former president of the American Motorcyclist Association (AMA) who said 99 percent of riders were law-biding while the remainder were outlaws.
